cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central-to-lower Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor-Corpus Christi, TX coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward past Galveston to High Island and adjacent Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–45 mph) possible late Friday through Saturday at Galveston.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the upper Texas coast and in Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with isolated higher amounts could fall, bringing a threat of flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents expected to develop ahead of the system.
